trans-unit.source: *filename (optional): name of picture as str; if not provided, will use current filename. NOTE: if provided, user must ensure file extension (suffix) is correct. For example, if photo is .CR2 file, edited image may be .jpeg. If you provide an extension different than what the actual file is, export will print a warning but will happily export the photo using the incorrect file extension. e.g. to get the extension of the edited photo, look at PhotoInfo.path_edited.

trans-unit.source: rhettbull/photosmeta: uses osxphotos and exiftool to apply metadata from Photos as exif data in the photo files. Can also export photos while preserving metadata and also apply Photos keywords as spotlight tags to make it easier to search for photos using spotlight. This is mostly made obsolete by osxphotos. The one feature that photosmeta has that osxphotos does not is ability to update the metadata of the actual photo files in the Photos library without exporting them. (Use with caution!)
trans-unit.target: rhettbull/photosmeta: uses osxphotos and exiftool to apply metadata from Photos as exif data in the photo files. Can also export photos while preserving metadata and also apply Photos keywords as spotlight tags to make it easier to search for photos using spotlight. This is mostly made obsolete by osxphotos. The one feature that photosmeta has that osxphotos does not is ability to update the metadata of the actual photo files in the Photos library without exporting them. (Use with caution!)

trans-unit.source: Caution: I caution against writing new EXIF data to photos in the Photos library because this will overwrite the original copy of the photo and could adversely affect how Photos behaves. exiftool.as_dict() is useful for getting access to all the photos information but if you want to write new EXIF data, I recommend you export the photo first then write the data. PhotoInfo.export() does this if called with exiftool=True.
trans-unit.target: Caution: I caution against writing new EXIF data to photos in the Photos library because this will overwrite the original copy of the photo and could adversely affect how Photos behaves. exiftool.as_dict() is useful for getting access to all the photos information but if you want to write new EXIF data, I recommend you export the photo first then write the data. PhotoInfo.export() does this if called with exiftool=True .

trans-unit.source: Implementation Note: Because the usual python file copy methods don't preserve all the metadata available on MacOS, export uses /usr/bin/ditto to do the copy for export. ditto preserves most metadata such as extended attributes, permissions, ACLs, etc.
trans-unit.target: Implementation Note: Because the usual python file copy methods don't preserve all the metadata available on MacOS, export uses /usr/bin/ditto to do the copy for export. ditto preserves most metadata such as extended attributes, permissions, ACLs, etc.

trans-unit.source: Note PhotosDB.photos() may return a different number of photos than Photos.app reports in the GUI. This is because photos() returns hidden photos, shared photos, and for burst photos, all selected burst images even if non-selected burst images have not been deleted. Photos only reports 1 single photo for each set of burst images until you "finalize" the burst by selecting key photos and deleting the others using the "Make a selection" option.
trans-unit.target: Note PhotosDB.photos() may return a different number of photos than Photos.app reports in the GUI. This is because photos() returns hidden photos, shared photos, and for burst photos, all selected burst images even if non-selected burst images have not been deleted. Photos only reports 1 single photo for each set of burst images until you "finalize" the burst by selecting key photos and deleting the others using the "Make a selection" option.

trans-unit.source: Note: If neither path or dbfile is passed, PhotosDB will use get_last_library_path to open the last opened Photos library. This usually works but is not 100% reliable. It can also lead to loading a different library than expected if the user has held down option key when opening Photos to switch libraries. It is therefore recommended you explicitely pass the path to PhotosDB().
trans-unit.target: Note: If neither path or dbfile is passed, PhotosDB will use get_last_library_path to open the last opened Photos library. This usually works but is not 100% reliable. It can also lead to loading a different library than expected if the user has held down option key when opening Photos to switch libraries. It is therefore recommended you explicitely pass the path to PhotosDB() .

trans-unit.source: Note: In Photos 5.0 (MacOS 10.15/Catalina), It is possible to have more than one album with the same name in Photos. Albums with duplicate names are treated as a single album and the photos in each are combined. For example, if you have two albums named "Wedding" and each has 2 photos, osxphotos will treat this as a single album named "Wedding" with 4 photos in it.

trans-unit.source: Apple does provide a framework (PhotoKit) for querying the user's Photos library and I attempted to create the funcationality in this package using this framework but unfortunately PhotoKit does not provide access to much of the needed metadata (such as Faces/Persons) and Apple's System Integrity Protection (SIP) made the interface unreliable. If you'd like to experiment with the PhotoKit interface, here's some sample code. While copying the sqlite file is a bit kludgy, it allows osxphotos to provide access to all available metadata.
trans-unit.target: Apple does provide a framework (PhotoKit) for querying the user's Photos library and I attempted to create the funcationality in this package using this framework but unfortunately PhotoKit does not provide access to much of the needed metadata (such as Faces/Persons) and Apple's System Integrity Protection (SIP) made the interface unreliable. If you'd like to experiment with the PhotoKit interface, here's some sample code. While copying the sqlite file is a bit kludgy, it allows osxphotos to provide access to all available metadata.

trans-unit.source: Example below gets list of all photos that are bursts, selects one of of them and prints out the names of the other images in the burst set. PhotosDB.photos() will only return the photos in the burst set that the user selected using "Make a Selection..." in Photos or the key image Photos selected if the user has not yet made a selection. This is similar to how Photos displays and counts burst photos. Using burst_photos you can access the other images in the burst set to export them, etc.

PhotosDB.photos() will only return the photos in the burst set that the user selected using "Make a Selection..." in Photos or the key image Photos selected if the user has not yet made a selection. This is similar to how Photos displays and counts burst photos. Using burst_photos you can access the other images in the burst set to export them, etc.

trans-unit.source: For example, in my library, Photos says I have 19,386 photos and 474 movies. However, PhotosDB.photos() reports 25,002 photos. The difference is due to 5,609 shared photos and 7 hidden photos. (Note Shared photos only valid for Photos 5). Similarly, filtering for just movies returns 625 results. The difference between 625 and 474 reported by Photos is due to 151 shared movies.

trans-unit.source: I use py-applescript by "Raymond Yee / rdhyee" to interact with Photos. Rather than import this package, I included the entire package (which is published as public domain code) in a private package to prevent ambiguity with other applescript packages on PyPi. py-applescript uses a native bridge via PyObjC and is very fast compared to the other osascript based packages.
trans-unit.target: I use py-applescript by "Raymond Yee / rdhyee" to interact with Photos. Rather than import this package, I included the entire package (which is published as public domain code) in a private package to prevent ambiguity with other applescript packages on PyPi. py-applescript uses a native bridge via PyObjC and is very fast compared to the other osascript based packages.

trans-unit.source: OSXPhotos
trans-unit.target: OSXPhotos

trans-unit.source: OSXPhotos provides the ability to interact with and query Apple's Photos.app library database on MacOS. Using this package you can query the Photos database for information about the photos stored in a Photos library on your Mac--for example, file name, file path, and metadata such as keywords/tags, persons/faces, albums, etc. You can also easily export both the original and edited photos.
trans-unit.target: OSXPhotos ofrece la posibilidad de interactuar y consultar la base de datos de la biblioteca de Photos.app de Apple en MacOS.Con este paquete puede consultar la base de datos de Fotos para obtener información sobre las fotos almacenadas en la biblioteca de Fotos de su Mac,por ejemplo,nombre de archivo,ruta de archivo y metadatos como palabras clave/etiquetas,personas/caras,álbumes,etc.También puede exportar fácilmente tanto las fotos originales como las editadas.

trans-unit.source: Package Interface
trans-unit.target: Interfaz del paquete

trans-unit.source: Pass the fully qualified path to the Photos library or the actual database file inside the library. The database is called photos.db and resides in the database folder in your Photos library. If you pass only the path to the library, PhotosDB will add the database path automatically. The option to pass the actual database path is provided so database files can be queried even if separated from the actual .photoslibrary file.
trans-unit.target: Pasa el camino totalmente cualificado a la biblioteca de fotos o al archivo de la base de datos real dentro de la biblioteca.La base de datos se llama photos.db y reside en la carpeta de la base de datos de la biblioteca de fotos.Si sólo pasa la ruta de acceso a la biblioteca,PhotosDB añadirá la ruta de la base de datos automáticamente.La opción de pasar la ruta de la base de datos real se proporciona para que se puedan consultar los archivos de la base de datos aunque estén separados del archivo .photoslibrary real.

trans-unit.source: Pass the path to a Photos library or to a specific database file (e.g. "/Users/smith/Pictures/Photos Library.photoslibrary" or "/Users/smith/Pictures/Photos Library.photoslibrary/database/photos.db"). Normally, it's recommended you pass the path the .photoslibrary folder, not the actual database path. The latter option is provided for debugging -- e.g. for reading a database file if you don't have the entire library. Path to photos library may be passed either as first argument or as named argument dbfile. Note: In Photos, users may specify a different library to open by holding down the option key while opening Photos.app. See also get_last_library_path and get_system_library_path
trans-unit.target: Pass the path to a Photos library or to a specific database file (e.g. "/Users/smith/Pictures/Photos Library.photoslibrary" or "/Users/smith/Pictures/Photos Library.photoslibrary/database/photos.db"). Normally, it's recommended you pass the path the .photoslibrary folder, not the actual database path. The latter option is provided for debugging -- e.g. for reading a database file if you don't have the entire library. trans-unit.source: RAW images imported to Photos with an associated jpeg preview are not handled correctly by osxphotos. osxphotos query and export will operate on the jpeg preview instead of the RAW image as will PhotoInfo.path. If the user selects "Use RAW as original" in Photos, the RAW image will be exported or operated on but the jpeg will be ignored. See Issue #101. Note: Beta version of fix for this bug is implemented in the current version of osxphotos.
trans-unit.target: RAW images imported to Photos with an associated jpeg preview are not handled correctly by osxphotos. osxphotos query and export will operate on the jpeg preview instead of the RAW image as will PhotoInfo.path . If the user selects "Use RAW as original" in Photos, the RAW image will be exported or operated on but the jpeg will be ignored. See Issue #101. trans-unit.source: Returns True if the original image file is missing on disk, otherwise False. trans-unit.source: Returns True if type is photo/still image, otherwise False
trans-unit.target: Devuelve True si el tipo es foto/imagen fija,de lo contrario False

trans-unit.source: Returns Uniform Type Identifier (UTI) for the image, for example: 'public.jpeg' or 'com.apple.quicktime-movie'
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el Identificador de Tipo Uniforme (UTI)para la imagen,por ejemplo:"public.jpeg" o "com.apple.quicktime-movie

trans-unit.source: Returns a FolderInfo object representing the albums parent folder or None if album is not a in a folder.
trans-unit.target: Returns a FolderInfo object representing the albums parent folder or None if album is not a in a folder.

trans-unit.source: Returns a FolderInfo object representing the folder's parent folder or None if album is not a in a folder.
trans-unit.target: Returns a FolderInfo object representing the folder's parent folder or None if album is not a in a folder.

trans-unit.source: Returns a PlaceInfo object with reverse geolocation data or None if there is the photo has no reverse geolocation information.
trans-unit.target: Returns a PlaceInfo object with reverse geolocation data or None if there is the photo has no reverse geolocation information.

trans-unit.source: Returns a ScoreInfo data class object which provides access to the computed aesthetic scores for each photo.
trans-unit.target: Returns a ScoreInfo data class object which provides access to the computed aesthetic scores for each photo.

trans-unit.source: Returns a PlaceNames namedtuple with the following fields. Each field is a list with zero or more values, sorted by area in ascending order. E.g. names.area_of_interest could be ['Gulf Islands National Seashore', 'Santa Rosa Island'], ["Knott's Berry Farm"], or [] if area_of_interest not defined. The value shown in Photos is the first value in the list. With the exception of body_of_water each of these field corresponds to an attribute of a CLPlacemark object. Note The PlaceNames namedtuple contains reserved fields not listed below (see implementation for details), thus it should be referenced only by name (e.g. names.city) and not by index.
trans-unit.target: Returns a PlaceNames namedtuple with the following fields. Each field is a list with zero or more values, sorted by area in ascending order. E.g. names.area_of_interest could be ['Gulf Islands National Seashore', 'Santa Rosa Island'], ["Knott's Berry Farm"], or [] if area_of_interest not defined. The value shown in Photos is the first value in the list. With the exception of body_of_water each of these field corresponds to an attribute of a CLPlacemark object. Note The PlaceNames namedtuple contains reserved fields not listed below (see implementation for details), thus it should be referenced only by name (e.g. names.city ) and not by index.

trans-unit.source: Returns a PostalAddress namedtuple with details of the postal address containing the following fields:
trans-unit.target: Returns a PostalAddress namedtuple with details of the postal address containing the following fields:

trans-unit.source: Returns a JSON representation of all photo info
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una representación JSON de toda la información fotográfica

trans-unit.source: Returns a JSON representation of the FaceInfo instance.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una representación JSON de la instancia FaceInfo.

trans-unit.source: Returns a PhotoInfo instance for the photo designated as the key photo for the person. This is the Photos uses to display the person's face thumbnail in Photos' "People" view.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una instancia de PhotoInfo para la foto designada como la foto clave de la persona.Esta es la foto que se usa para mostrar la miniatura de la cara de la persona en la vista "Gente" de las fotos.

trans-unit.source: Returns a PhotosDB object.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un objeto PhotosDB.

trans-unit.source: Returns a count of how many times this person appears in images in the database.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un recuento de cuántas veces aparece esta persona en las imágenes de la base de datos.

trans-unit.source: Returns a dictionary of albums found in the Photos library where key is the album name and value is the count of how many photos are in the album. Resulting dictionary is in reverse sorted order (e.g. album with the most photos is listed first).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un diccionario de los álbumes que se encuentran en la biblioteca de fotos donde la clave es el nombre del álbum y el valor es el recuento de cuántas fotos hay en el álbum.El diccionario resultante está en orden inverso (por ejemplo,el álbum con más fotos aparece en primer lugar).

trans-unit.source: Returns a dictionary of keywords found in the Photos library where key is the keyword and value is the count of how many times that keyword appears in the library (ie. how many photos are tagged with the keyword). Resulting dictionary is in reverse sorted order (e.g. keyword with the highest count is first).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un diccionario de palabras clave que se encuentran en la biblioteca de fotos donde la clave es la palabra clave y el valor es el recuento de cuántas veces aparece esa palabra clave en la biblioteca (es decir,cuántas fotos están etiquetadas con la palabra clave).El diccionario resultante está en orden inverso (por ejemplo,la palabra clave con el mayor número es la primera).

trans-unit.source: Returns a dictionary of persons (faces) found in the Photos library where key is the person name and value is the count of how many times that person appears in the library (ie. how many photos are tagged with the person). Resulting dictionary is in reverse sorted order (e.g. person who appears in the most photos is listed first). Note: It is of course possible to have more than one person with the same name, e.g. "Maria Smith", in the database. persons_as_dict assumes these are the same person and will list only one person named "Maria Smith". If you need more information about persons in the database, see person_info.
trans-unit.target: Returns a dictionary of persons (faces) found in the Photos library where key is the person name and value is the count of how many times that person appears in the library (ie. how many photos are tagged with the person). Resulting dictionary is in reverse sorted order (e.g. person who appears in the most photos is listed first). Note: It is of course possible to have more than one person with the same name, e.g. "Maria Smith", in the database. persons_as_dict assumes these are the same person and will list only one person named "Maria Smith". If you need more information about persons in the database, see person_info.

trans-unit.source: Returns a dictionary of shared albums (e.g. shared via iCloud photo sharing) found in the Photos library where key is the album name and value is the count of how many photos are in the album. Resulting dictionary is in reverse sorted order (e.g. album with the most photos is listed first).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un diccionario de álbumes compartidos (por ejemplo,compartido a través de compartir fotos en iCloud)que se encuentra en la Biblioteca de fotos,donde la clave es el nombre del álbum y el valor es el recuento de cuántas fotos hay en el álbum.El diccionario resultante está en orden inverso (por ejemplo,el álbum con más fotos aparece en primer lugar).

trans-unit.source: Returns a dictionary representation of the FaceInfo instance.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una representación de diccionario de la instancia FaceInfo.

trans-unit.source: Returns a hierarchical list of FolderInfo objects representing the folders the album is contained in. For example, if album "AlbumInFolder" is in SubFolder2 of Folder1 as illustrated below, would return a list of FolderInfo objects representing ["Folder1", "SubFolder2"]
trans-unit.target: Returns a hierarchical list of FolderInfo objects representing the folders the album is contained in. For example, if album "AlbumInFolder" is in SubFolder2 of Folder1 as illustrated below, would return a list of FolderInfo objects representing ["Folder1", "SubFolder2"]

trans-unit.source: Returns a hierarchical list of names of the folders the album is contained in. For example, if album is in SubFolder2 of Folder1 as illustrated below, would return ["Folder1", "SubFolder2"].
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una lista jerárquica de nombres de las carpetas en las que se encuentra el álbum.Por ejemplo,si el álbum está en la Subcarpeta2 de la Carpeta1,como se ilustra a continuación,devolvería ["Carpeta1","Subcarpeta2"].

trans-unit.source: Returns a json string representation of the PersonInfo instance.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una representación en cadena de json de la instancia PersonInfo.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list names of top level folder names in the database.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una lista de nombres de carpetas de alto nivel en la base de datos.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of AlbumInfo objects representing albums in the database or empty list if there are no albums. See also albums.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of AlbumInfo objects representing albums in the database or empty list if there are no albums. See also albums.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of AlbumInfo objects representing each album contained in the folder.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of AlbumInfo objects representing each album contained in the folder.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of AlbumInfo objects representing the albums the photo is contained in. See also albums.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of AlbumInfo objects representing the albums the photo is contained in. See also albums.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of FolderInfo objects representing the sub-folders of the folder.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of FolderInfo objects representing the sub-folders of the folder.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of FolderInfo objects representing top level folders in the database or empty list if there are no folders. See also folders.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of FolderInfo objects representing top level folders in the database or empty list if there are no folders. See also folders.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of PhotoInfo objects representing each photo contained in the album sorted in the same order as in Photos. (e.g. if photos were manually sorted in the Photos albums, photos returned by photos will be in same order as they appear in the Photos album)
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of PhotoInfo objects representing each photo contained in the album sorted in the same order as in Photos. (e.g. if photos were manually sorted in the Photos albums, photos returned by photos will be in same order as they appear in the Photos album)

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of PhotoInfo objects representing each photo contained in the import session.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of PhotoInfo objects representing each photo contained in the import session.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of PhotoInfo objects. Each PhotoInfo object represents a photo in the Photos Libary.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of PhotoInfo objects. Each PhotoInfo object represents a photo in the Photos Libary.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of FaceInfo objects associated with this person sorted by quality score. Highest quality face is result[0] and lowest quality face is result[n].
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of FaceInfo objects associated with this person sorted by quality score. Highest quality face is result[0] and lowest quality face is result[n].

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of FaceInfo objects representing faces in the photo. Each face is associated with the a PersonInfo object.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of FaceInfo objects representing faces in the photo. Each face is associated with the a PersonInfo object.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of ImportInfo objects representing the import sessions for the database.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of ImportInfo objects representing the import sessions for the database.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of PersonInfo objects representing persons in the photo. Each PersonInfo object is associated with one or more FaceInfo objects.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of PersonInfo objects representing persons in the photo. Each PersonInfo object is associated with one or more FaceInfo objects.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of PersonInfo objects representing persons who appear in photos in the database.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of PersonInfo objects representing persons who appear in photos in the database.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of PhotoInfo objects representing all photos the person appears in.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una lista de objetos PhotoInfo que representan todas las fotos en las que aparece la persona.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of albums the photo is contained in. See also album_info.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of albums the photo is contained in. See also album_info.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of keywords (e.g. tags) applied to the photo
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una lista de palabras clave (por ejemplo,etiquetas)aplicadas a la foto

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of the album names found in the Photos library.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una lista de los nombres de los álbumes que se encuentran en la biblioteca de fotos.

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of the keywords found in the Photos library
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una lista de las palabras clave encontradas en la biblioteca de fotos

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of the names of the persons in the photo
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una lista de los nombres de las personas en la foto

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of the person names (faces) found in the Photos library. Note: It is of course possible to have more than one person with the same name, e.g. "Maria Smith", in the database. persons assumes these are the same person and will list only one person named "Maria Smith". If you need more information about persons in the database, see person_info.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of the person names (faces) found in the Photos library. Note: It is of course possible to have more than one person with the same name, e.g. "Maria Smith", in the database. persons assumes these are the same person and will list only one person named "Maria Smith". If you need more information about persons in the database, see person_info.

trans-unit.source: Returns a single PhotoInfo instance for photo with UUID matching uuid or None if no photo is found matching uuid. If you know the UUID of a photo, get_photo() is much faster than photos. See also photos().
trans-unit.target: Returns a single PhotoInfo instance for photo with UUID matching uuid or None if no photo is found matching uuid . If you know the UUID of a photo, get_photo() is much faster than photos . See also photos().

trans-unit.source: Returns a tuple of (rendered, unmatched) where rendered is a list of rendered strings with all substitutions made and unmatched is a list of any strings that resembled a template substitution but did not match a known substitution. E.g. if template contained "{foo}", unmatched would be ["foo"].
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una tupla de (renderizado,no emparejado)donde renderizado es una lista de cadenas renderizadas con todas las sustituciones realizadas y no emparejado es una lista de cualquier cadena que se asemeje a una sustitución de plantilla pero no coincida con una sustitución conocida.Por ejemplo,si la plantilla contiene "{foo}",la no coincidencia sería ["foo"].

trans-unit.source: Returns an ExifInfo object with EXIF details from the Photos database. See ExifInfo for additional details.
trans-unit.target: Returns an ExifInfo object with EXIF details from the Photos database. See ExifInfo for additional details.

trans-unit.source: Returns an ImportInfo object representing the import session associated with the photo or None if there is no associated import session.
trans-unit.target: Returns an ImportInfo object representing the import session associated with the photo or None if there is no associated import session.

trans-unit.source: Returns an ExifTool object for the photo which provides an interface to exiftool allowing you to read or write the actual EXIF data in the image file inside the Photos library. If exif_info doesn't give you all the data you need, you can use exiftool to read the entire EXIF contents of the image.
trans-unit.target: Returns an ExifTool object for the photo which provides an interface to exiftool allowing you to read or write the actual EXIF data in the image file inside the Photos library. If exif_info doesn't give you all the data you need, you can use exiftool to read the entire EXIF contents of the image.

trans-unit.source: Returns dictionary image categorization labels associated with photos in the library where key is label and value is number of photos in the library with the label.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve las etiquetas de categorización de imágenes del diccionario asociadas a las fotos de la biblioteca donde la clave es la etiqueta y el valor es el número de fotos de la biblioteca con la etiqueta.

trans-unit.source: Returns dictionary of image categorization labels associated with photos in the library where key is normalized label and value is number of photos in the library with that label. Labels are normalized (e.g. converted to lower case). Use of normalized strings makes it easier to search if you don't how Apple capitalizes a label.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el diccionario de etiquetas de categorización de imágenes asociadas a las fotos de la biblioteca donde la clave es la etiqueta normalizada y el valor es el número de fotos de la biblioteca con esa etiqueta.Las etiquetas se normalizan (por ejemplo,se convierten a minúsculas).El uso de cadenas normalizadas facilita la búsqueda si no sabes cómo Apple escribe una etiqueta en mayúsculas.

trans-unit.source: Returns height of the original photo in pixels. See also height.
trans-unit.target: Returns height of the original photo in pixels. See also height.

trans-unit.source: Returns height of the photo in pixels. If image has been edited, returns height of the edited image, otherwise returns height of the original image. See also original_height.
trans-unit.target: Returns height of the photo in pixels. If image has been edited, returns height of the edited image, otherwise returns height of the original image. See also original_height.

trans-unit.source: Returns image categorization labels associated with photos in the library as list of str.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve las etiquetas de categorización de imágenes asociadas a las fotos de la biblioteca como lista de str.

trans-unit.source: Returns image categorization labels associated with photos in the library as list of str. Labels are normalized (e.g. converted to lower case). Use of normalized strings makes it easier to search if you don't how Apple capitalizes a label.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve las etiquetas de categorización de imágenes asociadas a las fotos de la biblioteca como lista de str.Las etiquetas se normalizan (por ejemplo,se convierten a minúsculas).El uso de cadenas normalizadas facilita la búsqueda si no sabes cómo Apple escribe una etiqueta en mayúsculas.

trans-unit.source: Returns image categorization labels associated with the photo as list of str.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve las etiquetas de categorización de imágenes asociadas a la foto como lista de str.

trans-unit.source: Returns image categorization labels associated with the photo as list of str. Labels are normalized (e.g. converted to lower case). Use of normalized strings makes it easier to search if you don't how Apple capitalizes a label. For example:
trans-unit.target: Devuelve las etiquetas de categorización de imágenes asociadas a la foto como lista de str.Las etiquetas se normalizan (por ejemplo,se convierten a minúsculas).El uso de cadenas normalizadas hace más fácil la búsqueda si no se sabe cómo Apple escribe una etiqueta en mayúsculas.Por ejemplo:

trans-unit.source: Returns latitude and longitude as a tuple of floats (latitude, longitude). If location is not set, latitude and longitude are returned as None
trans-unit.target: Returns latitude and longitude as a tuple of floats (latitude, longitude). If location is not set, latitude and longitude are returned as None

trans-unit.source: Returns list of Photos libraries found on the system. Note: On MacOS 10.15, this appears to list all libraries. On older systems, it may not find some libraries if they are not located in ~/Pictures. Provided for convenience but do not rely on this to find all libraries on the system.
trans-unit.target: Returns list of Photos libraries found on the system. Note: On MacOS 10.15, this appears to list all libraries. On older systems, it may not find some libraries if they are not located in ~/Pictures. Provided for convenience but do not rely on this to find all libraries on the system.

trans-unit.source: Returns list of shared album names found in photos database (e.g. albums shared via iCloud photo sharing)
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la lista de nombres de álbumes compartidos que se encuentran en la base de datos de fotos (por ejemplo,álbumes compartidos mediante el uso compartido de fotos en iCloud)

trans-unit.source: Returns list of x, y coordinates as tuples [(x0, y0), (x1, y1)] representing the corners of rectangular region that contains the face. Coordinates are in same format and reference frame as used by Pillow imaging library. Note: face_rect() and all other properties/methods that return coordinates refer to the current version of the image. E.g. if the image has been edited (PhotoInfo.hasadjustments), these refer to PhotoInfo.path_edited. If the image has no adjustments, these coordinates refer to the original photo (PhotoInfo.path).
trans-unit.target: Returns list of x, y coordinates as tuples [(x0, y0), (x1, y1)] representing the corners of rectangular region that contains the face. Coordinates are in same format and reference frame as used by Pillow imaging library. Note: face_rect() and all other properties/methods that return coordinates refer to the current version of the image. E.g. if the image has been edited ( PhotoInfo.hasadjustments ), these refer to PhotoInfo.path_edited . If the image has no adjustments, these coordinates refer to the original photo ( PhotoInfo.path ).

trans-unit.source: Returns path to last opened Photo Library as string.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el camino a la última fototeca abierta como cadena.

trans-unit.source: Returns size of the original photo in bytes as integer.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el tamaño de la foto original en bytes como un entero.

trans-unit.source: Returns the UUID of the person as stored in the Photos library database.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el UUID de la persona tal y como está almacenado en la base de datos de la Fototeca.

trans-unit.source: Returns the absolute path to the edited photo on disk as a string. If the photo has not been edited, returns None. See also path and hasadjustments.
trans-unit.target: Returns the absolute path to the edited photo on disk as a string. If the photo has not been edited, returns None . See also path and hasadjustments.

trans-unit.source: Returns the absolute path to the photo on disk as a string. Note: this returns the path to the original unedited file (see hasadjustments). If the file is missing on disk, path=None (see ismissing).
trans-unit.target: Returns the absolute path to the photo on disk as a string. Note: this returns the path to the original unedited file (see hasadjustments). If the file is missing on disk, path= None (see ismissing).

trans-unit.source: Returns the country_code of place, for example "GB". Returns None if PhotoInfo contains no country code.
trans-unit.target: Returns the country_code of place, for example "GB". Returns None if PhotoInfo contains no country code.

trans-unit.source: Returns the create date of the photo as a datetime.datetime object
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fecha de creación de la foto como un objeto datetime.datetime

trans-unit.source: Returns the creation date as a timezone aware datetime.datetime object of the album.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fecha de creación como un objeto datetime.datetime consciente de la zona horaria del álbum.

trans-unit.source: Returns the creation date as a timezone aware datetime.datetime object of the import session.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fecha de creación como un objeto datetime.datetime consciente de la zona horaria de la sesión de importación.

trans-unit.source: Returns the current filename of the photo on disk. See also original_filename
trans-unit.target: Returns the current filename of the photo on disk. See also original_filename

trans-unit.source: Returns the date of earliest photo in the album as a timezone aware datetime.datetime object.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fecha de la primera foto del álbum como un objeto datetime.datetime consciente de la zona horaria.

trans-unit.source: Returns the date of latest photo in the album as a timezone aware datetime.datetime object.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fecha de la última foto del álbum como un objeto datetime.datetime consciente de la zona horaria.

trans-unit.source: Returns the description of the photo
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la descripción de la foto

trans-unit.source: Returns the display name of the person represented in the photo. For example, "Maria".
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el nombre de la persona representada en la foto.Por ejemplo,"María".

trans-unit.source: Returns the end date as a timezone aware datetime.datetime object for when the import session completed.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fecha final como un objeto datetime.datetime consciente de la zona horaria para cuando se complete la sesión de importación.

trans-unit.source: Returns the full name of the person represented in the photo. For example, "Maria Smith".
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el nombre completo de la persona representada en la foto.Por ejemplo,"Maria Smith".

trans-unit.source: Returns the full postal address as a string if defined, otherwise None.
trans-unit.target: Returns the full postal address as a string if defined, otherwise None .

trans-unit.source: Returns the modification date of the photo as a datetime.datetime object or None if photo has no modification date
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fecha de modificación de la foto como un objeto datetime.datetime o None si la foto no tiene fecha de modificación

trans-unit.source: Returns the name of the local place as str. This is what Photos displays in the Info window. Note Photos 5 uses a different algorithm to determine the name than earlier versions which means the same Photo may have a different place name in Photos 4 and Photos 5. PhotoInfo.name will return the name Photos would have shown depending on the version of the library being processed. In Photos 5, the place name is generally more detailed than in earlier versions of Photos.
trans-unit.target: Returns the name of the local place as str. This is what Photos displays in the Info window. Note Photos 5 uses a different algorithm to determine the name than earlier versions which means the same Photo may have a different place name in Photos 4 and Photos 5. PhotoInfo.name will return the name Photos would have shown depending on the version of the library being processed. In Photos 5, the place name is generally more detailed than in earlier versions of Photos.

trans-unit.source: Returns the original filename of the photo when it was imported to Photos. Note: Photos 5.0+ renames the photo when it adds the file to the library using UUID. See also filename
trans-unit.target: Returns the original filename of the photo when it was imported to Photos. Note: Photos 5.0+ renames the photo when it adds the file to the library using UUID. See also filename

trans-unit.source: Returns the path to the Photos database PhotosDB was initialized with
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el camino a la base de datos de fotos PhotosDB fue inicializado con

trans-unit.source: Returns the path to the Photos library as a string
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el camino a la Fototeca como una cadena

trans-unit.source: Returns the path to the live video component of a live photo. If photo is not a live photo, returns None.
trans-unit.target: Returns the path to the live video component of a live photo. If photo is not a live photo, returns None.

trans-unit.source: Returns the start date as a timezone aware datetime.datetime object for when the import session bega.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fecha de inicio como una zona horaria conocida datetime.datetime objeto para cuando se inicia la sesión de importación.

trans-unit.source: Returns the title of the photo
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el título de la foto

trans-unit.source: Returns the title or name of the album.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el título o el nombre del álbum.

trans-unit.source: Returns the title or name of the folder.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el título o el nombre de la carpeta.

trans-unit.source: Returns the universally unique identifier (uuid) of the album. This is how Photos keeps track of individual objects within the database.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el identificador único universal (uuid)del álbum.Así es como Fotos hace un seguimiento de los objetos individuales dentro de la base de datos.

trans-unit.source: Returns the universally unique identifier (uuid) of the folder. This is how Photos keeps track of individual objects within the database.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el identificador único universal (uuid)de la carpeta.Así es como Photos mantiene un seguimiento de los objetos individuales dentro de la base de datos.

trans-unit.source: Returns the universally unique identifier (uuid) of the import session. This is how Photos keeps track of individual objects within the database.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el identificador único universal (uuid)de la sesión de importación.Así es como Photos mantiene un seguimiento de los objetos individuales dentro de la base de datos.

trans-unit.source: Returns the universally unique identifier (uuid) of the photo. This is how Photos keeps track of individual photos within the database.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el identificador único universal (uuid)de la foto.Así es como Fotos mantiene un seguimiento de las fotos individuales dentro de la base de datos.

trans-unit.source: Returns the version number for Photos library database. You likely won't need this but it's provided in case needed for debugging. PhotosDB will print a warning to sys.stderr if you open a database version that has not been tested.
trans-unit.target: Returns the version number for Photos library database. You likely won't need this but it's provided in case needed for debugging. PhotosDB will print a warning to sys.stderr if you open a database version that has not been tested.

trans-unit.source: Returns tuple of (connection, cursor) for the working copy of the Photos database. This is useful for debugging or prototyping new features.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la tupla de (conexión,cursor)para la copia de trabajo de la base de datos de fotos.Esto es útil para depurar o crear prototipos de nuevas características.

trans-unit.source: Some substitutions, notably album, keyword, and person could return multiple values, hence a new string will be return for each possible substitution (hence why a list of rendered strings is returned). For example, a photo in 2 albums: 'Vacation' and 'Family' would result in the following rendered values if template was "{created.year}/{album}" and created.year == 2020: ["2020/Vacation","2020/Family"]

trans-unit.source: Testing against "real world" Photos libraries would be especially helpful. If you discover issues in testing against your Photos libraries, please open an issue. I've done extensive testing against my own Photos library but that's a since data point and I'm certain there are issues lurking in various edge cases I haven't discovered yet.
trans-unit.target: Las pruebas con las bibliotecas de fotos del "mundo real" serían especialmente útiles.Si descubres problemas en las pruebas con tus bibliotecas de fotos,por favor abre un número.He realizado pruebas exhaustivas con mi propia biblioteca de fotos,pero es un punto de datos desde entonces y estoy seguro de que hay problemas que acechan en varios casos extremos que aún no he descubierto.

trans-unit.source: The following substitutions are availabe for use with PhotoInfo.render_template() | Substitution | Description | |--------------|-------------| |{name}|Current filename of the photo| |{original_name}|Photo's original filename when imported to Photos| |{title}|Title of the photo| |{descr}|Description of the photo| |{created.date}|Photo's creation date in ISO format, e.g. '2020-03-22'| |{created.year}|4-digit year of file creation time| |{created.yy}|2-digit year of file creation time| |{created.mm}|2-digit month of the file creation time (zero padded)| |{created.month}|Month name in user's locale of the file creation time| |{created.mon}|Month abbreviation in the user's locale of the file creation time| |{created.dd}|2-digit day of the month (zero padded) of file creation time| |{created.dow}|Day of week in user's locale of the file creation time| |{created.doy}|3-digit day of year (e.g Julian day) of file creation time, starting from 1 (zero padded)| |{created.hour}|2-digit hour of the file creation time| |{created.min}|2-digit minute of the file creation time| |{created.sec}|2-digit second of the file creation time| |{created.strftime}|Apply strftime template to file creation date/time. trans-unit.source: This package will install a command line utility called osxphotos that allows you to query the Photos database. Alternatively, you can also run the command line utility like this: python3 -m osxphotos
trans-unit.target: This package will install a command line utility called osxphotos that allows you to query the Photos database. Alternatively, you can also run the command line utility like this: python3 -m osxphotos

trans-unit.source: This package will read Photos databases for any supported version on any supported OS version. E.g. you can read a database created with Photos 4.0 on MacOS 10.14 on a machine running MacOS 10.12.
trans-unit.target: Este paquete leerá bases de datos de fotos para cualquier versión soportada en cualquier versión de SO soportada.Por ejemplo,puede leer una base de datos creada con Photos 4.0 en MacOS 10.14 en una máquina con MacOS 10.12.

trans-unit.source: This package works by creating a copy of the sqlite3 database that photos uses to store data about the photos library. The class PhotosDB then queries this database to extract information about the photos such as persons (faces identified in the photos), albums, keywords, etc. If your library is large, the database can be hundreds of MB in size and the copy read then can take many 10s of seconds to complete. Once copied, the entire database is processed and an in-memory data structure is created meaning all subsequent accesses of the PhotosDB object occur much more quickly.
trans-unit.target: Este paquete funciona creando una copia de la base de datos de sqlite3 que las fotos utilizan para almacenar datos sobre la biblioteca de fotos.La clase PhotosDB luego consulta esta base de datos para extraer información sobre las fotos como personas (rostros identificados en las fotos),álbumes,palabras clave,etc.Si su biblioteca es grande,la base de datos puede tener un tamaño de cientos de MB y la copia leída entonces puede tardar muchos 10s de segundos en completarse.Una vez copiada,se procesa toda la base de datos y se crea una estructura de datos en memoria,lo que significa que todos los accesos posteriores del objeto PhotosDB se producen mucho más rápidamente.

trans-unit.source: exiftool must be installed in the path for this to work. If exiftool cannot be found in the path, calling exiftool will log a warning and return None. You can check the exiftool path using osxphotos.exiftool.get_exiftool_path which will raise FileNotFoundError if exiftool cannot be found.
trans-unit.target: exiftool must be installed in the path for this to work. If exiftool cannot be found in the path, calling exiftool will log a warning and return None . You can check the exiftool path using osxphotos.exiftool.get_exiftool_path which will raise FileNotFoundError if exiftool cannot be found.

trans-unit.source: use_photos_export: boolean; (default=False), if True will attempt to export photo via applescript interaction with Photos; useful for forcing download of missing photos. This only works if the Photos library being used is the default library (last opened by Photos) as applescript will directly interact with whichever library Photos is currently using.
trans-unit.target: use_photos_export:booleano;(default=Falso),si es Verdadero intentará exportar la foto a través de la interacción de la secuencia de comandos con Fotos;útil para forzar la descarga de fotos perdidas.Esto sólo funciona si la biblioteca de fotos que se está utilizando es la biblioteca predeterminada (la última que abrió Photos),ya que applescript interactuará directamente con la biblioteca que Photos esté utilizando en ese momento.
